title: Zero cut-off in NEET PG: Is India lowering the bar to keep hospitals running?
description: The National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS) has lowered NEET PG 2025 cut-offs, allowing candidates with negative marks to enter counselling for over 9,000 vacant PG seats. While officials cite seat utilisation, medical bodies warn this undermines merit, risks patient safety, and threatens the quality of India’s postgraduate medical education, raising urgent questions about training standards and healthcare outcomes.

title: Vulnerability warning: Android flaw risks remote code execution
description: Indian authorities have issued a critical warning to Android users regarding a Dolby audio vulnerability (CIVN–2026-0016). This flaw allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on targeted devices by exploiting a buffer overflow in Dolby DD+ decoding, potentially leading to memory corruption and crashes.

title: 'Poor planning': Nithin Kamath questions stock market closure during BMC polls
description: Zerodha founder Nithin Kamath criticized the closure of Indian stock exchanges on January 15 for Mumbai's municipal elections, citing poor planning and a lack of appreciation for second-order effects. He argued that such a holiday, driven by local civic polls, undermines global investor confidence. Trading is set to resume on January 16 after the election-related holiday.

title: Grok image generation ban: xAI blocks sexualised deepfakes; paid users face new limits
description: In response to mounting backlash and regulatory scrutiny, Grok AI has ceased the creation of explicit images of real individuals. xAI has introduced stringent technical measures to curb misuse, particularly addressing concerns around deepfake content involving women and minors. Furthermore, image generation and editing services are now reserved for paid X subscribers, with geoblocking mechanisms implemented to filter illegal material.

title: Nasa sends 4 astronauts back to Earth in first medical evacuation - watch

Fresh snowfall is likely in the Himalayan region around January 16. Delhi's air quality remains very poor.

description: A Punjabi businessman, Binder Garcha, was shot dead in Surrey, Canada. This incident follows similar killings of prominent Punjabi businessmen in the region. New York, bolstered by Josh Hart's return, aims to leverage their defensive strength against a struggling Sacramento team.

title: Google founders 'dump' California: Why tech billionaires are leaving
description: Google co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin are reportedly leaving California, with Page purchasing Miami estates and Brin considering a home there. This move mirrors Jeff Bezos' relocation from Seattle to Miami, potentially driven by tax advantages. California's proposed billionaire tax may also be a factor for wealthy residents.

title: Wayne Gretzky net worth timeline 2016–2026: earnings, investments and endorsements
description: Wayne Gretzky's net worth has grown to $250 million by 2026, a significant increase from his $200 million in 2016. This financial success, nearly quadrupling his career earnings, highlights his savvy business acumen through endorsements, strategic investments in real estate, and ownership stakes, proving his enduring brand power beyond hockey.

title: 'Her family warned her': Gisele Bündchen’s family favored Tom Brady over Valente
description: Gisele Bündchen’s family is reportedly uneasy about her marriage to Joaquim Valente, with Tom Brady still serving as a point of comparison. Sources claim relatives worry about financial imbalance and potential prenup loopholes, despite the couple’s happiness and growing family. While Bündchen appears confident in her choice, those closest to her remain cautious about long term security.
